alert.note: Alert for Gibson (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 02 at 3:53PM EDT until July 02 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN WHITE...WEST CENTRAL WARRICK...VANDERBURGH... SOUTHERN GIBSON...POSEY AND NORTHWESTERN HENDERSON COUNTIES... At 252 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near New Harmony to near Mount Vernon, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Evansville, Princeton, Mount Vernon, Fort Branch, Melody Hill, Haubstadt, Darmstadt, Owensville, Poseyville, New Harmony, Patoka, Cynthiana, Blairsville, Kasson, Elberfeld and Griffin. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 in Indiana between Mile Markers 8 and 25. Interstate 64 in Indiana between Mile Markers 1 and 30. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
